魯.definition: (bound form) crass; stupid; rude; (used to represent the sounds of "ru", "lu" etc in loanwords)

魯人.definition: person from Shandong; often refers to Confucius; stupid person

魯凱族.definition: Rukai, one of the indigenous peoples of Taiwan

魯史.definition: History of Kingdom Lu; refers to the Spring and Autumn Annals 春秋

魯君.definition: the lord of Lu (who declined to employ Confucius)

魯國.definition: Lu, vassal state at the time of the Zhou Dynasty 周朝|周朝[Zhou1 chao2], located in the southwest of present-day Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1], birthplace of Confucius

魯國人.definition: person from Shandong; often refers to Confucius

魯子敬.definition: Lu Zijing or Lu Su 魯肅|鲁肃 (172-217), statesman, diplomat and strategist of Eastern Wu 東吳|东吴

魯山.definition: Lushan county in Pingdingshan 平頂山|平顶山[Ping2 ding3 shan1], Henan

魯山縣.definition: Lushan county in Pingdingshan 平頂山|平顶山[Ping2 ding3 shan1], Henan

魯汶.definition: Leuven (a town in Belgium famous for its university)

魯爾河.definition: Ruhr River, a tributary of the Rhine in Germany

魯班.definition: Lu Ban, legendary master craftsman, called the father of Chinese carpentry

魯甸.definition: Ludian county in Zhaotong 昭通[Zhao1 tong1], Yunnan

魯甸縣.definition: Ludian county in Zhaotong 昭通[Zhao1 tong1], Yunnan

魯肅.definition: Lu Su or Lu Zijing 魯子敬|鲁子敬 (172-217), statesman, diplomat and strategist of Eastern Wu 東吳|东吴

魯賓.definition: Rubin (name); Robert E. Rubin (1938-), US Treasury Secretary 1995-1999 under President Clinton

魯迅.definition: Lu Xun (1881-1936), one of the earliest and best-known modern Chinese writers
